statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Jason Burnell scored 18 points and Marlon Hunter added 15 as Jacksonville State rallied in the second half to defeat Eastern Illinois 69-62 in an early meeting of Ohio Valley Conference unbeaten teams on Thursday.
article.headline: Burnell scores 18, Jacksonville State rallies to 69-62 win
article.linkText: Burnell scores 18, Jacksonville State rallies to 69-62 win
article.story: JACKSONVILLE, Ala. -- Jason Burnell scored 18 points and Marlon Hunter added 15 as Jacksonville State rallied in the second half to defeat Eastern Illinois 69-62 in an early meeting of Ohio Valley Conference unbeaten teams on Thursday. Jacksonville State (11-5, 3-0) led by a point at halftime but surged ahead 39-29 when Burnell buried back-to-back 3-pointers to open the second half. Eastern Illinois (9-7, 2-1) grabbed a short-lived 49-44 lead midway through the second half with a 10-0 run. Kashawn Charles and Mack Smith hit back-to-back 3s in the rally. Gregory dunked and converted the 3-point play to kick off a 13-0 run for the Gamecocks late in the game to seal the win. Eastern Illinois came no closer than four points in the final five minutes. Each time the Panthers closed, Jacksonville State responded with a 3-pointer -- one by Burnell and another by Detric Mostella, who finished with 12 points and three treys. Ben Harvey and Josiah Wallace each scored 14 points to lead the Panthers.
